intro: Chuquiraga trichophylla, commonly known as the Andean burr bush, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, spiny fruits that contain seeds, which are adapted for dispersal by wind or animals. Its leaves are typically hairy and adapted to withstand the harsh, cold conditions of its mountainous habitat. Chuquiraga trichophylla is often found in rocky soils and plays a role in stabilizing slopes in its native environment.
